text:
Authy vs Yubikey? I wonder if someone has comments if both options are ok for MFA. I just created a new AWS account, and I wanted to enable MFA for it.
I spent some time learning what Yubikey does, and wondered which one to get for a mac and ipad, and then I figured out that Authy is much easier to use.. And I don’t have to shell out € for a physical thing that’s cumbersome.

text: I don't know what mobile device you own, but I use andOTP and have exported my MFA keys into an encrypted file which I've cloned to another device

text: That said, I'm strongly thinking about going with some sort of hardware token in the future, provided I can create backups for that too
